front.title: A Method for Registering Internationalized Domain Names

abstract.t: This document describes some suggested practices for registering internationalized domain names (IDNs) in a zone. Before accepting registrations of domain names into a zone, the zone's registry should decide which codepoints in the Unicode character set the zone will accept. The registry should also decide whether particular characters in a registered domain name should cause registration of multiple equivalent domain names; these domain names might be added to the zone or blocked from registration. This document also describes how to handle character variants in registering IDNs, and how to publish tables that list the character variants.
